column4: FDA delays decision on key Alexion drug by 3 months
column5: Alexion Pharmaceuticals Inc said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration would delay by three months its decision on approving a key drug the company got through the acquisition of Synageva BioPharma Corp.

column4: RPT - INSIGHT-Automakers  Google take different roads to automated cars
column5: DETROIT  Sept 4 From his laboratory at Pittsburgh's Carnegie Mellon University  automated vehicle pioneer Raj Rajkumar says self-driving cars will evolve step-by-step  with humans staying in charge for a long time to come.

column4: Netflix makes big splash in Venice's film lagoon
column5: VENICE Venice may be the world's oldest film festival  but this year it is pioneering what may well become the future of cinema as Netflix screens two films here  one of them its first feature and a contender for the top prize. | Video

column4: Pop Gourmet CEO on sriracha  Starbucks and life after prison
column5: David Israel's four-year old company  Pop Gourmet  has a deal to sell snacks at Starbucks and a sought-after licensing agreement with uber-hip sriracha seller Huy Fong Foods  but it is his prison time that makes the brand stand-out in a crowded field.

column4: AstraZeneca wins U.S. approval for longer use of blood thinner
column5: U.S. regulators have approved a new dose of AstraZeneca's blood thinner Brilinta for longer-term use in patients with a history of heart attacks  boosting prospects for a drug the company thinks will eventually sell $3.5 billion a year.

column4: UPDATE 2-AstraZeneca wins U.S. approval for longer use of blood thinner
column5: * AstraZeneca targeting Brilinta sales of $3.5 bln by 2023   (Adds executive and analyst comments on Brilinta growth)

column4: BP shares at risk from M&A temptation: BAML
column5: LONDON BP will need to buy oil and gas fields to offset falling production  which could lead it to issue equity to raise funds  Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAML) said on Friday  cutting its rating on the oil major's shares to underperform from neutral.

column4: BP shares at risk from M&A temptation - BAML
column5: LONDON  Sept 4 BP will need to buy oil and gas fields to offset falling production  which could lead it to issue equity to raise funds  Bank of America Merrill Lynch (BAML) said on Friday  cutting its rating on the oil major's shares to underperform from neutral.

column4: Brazil's Braskem signs naphtha contract with Petrobras
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 4 Brazilian petrochemical firm Braskem SA said on Friday it signed a naphtha contract with state-run oil firm Petrobras  valid until the end of October.

column4: Canada's top court says Ecuadoreans can sue Chevron in Ontario
column5: OTTAWA Canada's top court ruled on Friday that a group of Ecuadorean villagers could pursue a multi-billion pollution lawsuit against Chevron Corp in the Canadian province of Ontario.

column4: UPDATE 3-Canada's top court says Ecuadoreans can sue Chevron in Ontario

column4: Top Canada court: Ecuador villagers can sue Chevron in Ontario
column5: OTTAWA  Sept 4 Canada's top court ruled on Friday that a group of Ecuadorian villagers could pursue a multi-billion dollar pollution lawsuit against Chevron Corp in the Canadian province of Ontario.

column4: ConocoPhillips signals conditional support for U.N. climate deal
column5: WASHINGTON Oil and gas producer ConocoPhillips on Friday said it would support a UN climate change agreement if it met its own policy principles  including creating a "level playing among energy sources and between countries."

column4: ConocoPhillips signals conditional support for UN climate deal
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 4 Oil and gas producer ConocoPhillips on Friday said it would support a UN climate change agreement if it met its own policy principles  including creating a "level playing among energy sources and between countries."

column4: Duke 37  Tulane 7
column5: Quarterback Thomas Sirk threw for 289 yards and two touchdowns in his starting debut  and DeVon Edwards returned a kickoff 95 yards for a touchdown as Duke opened the season by defeating Tulane 37-7 Thursday night in New Orleans.

column4: US regulator to tighten oversight on Entergy's Massachusetts plant
column5: The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission said it would increase oversight on Entergy Corp's 685-megawatt nuclear power plant in Massachusetts for violations related to unplanned shutdowns in 2013 and 2015.

column4: Fiat Chrysler U.S. to recall 7 810 SUVs to prevent hacking
column5: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's  U.S. arm said on Friday it would recall 7 810 sport utility vehicles in the United States to update software for radios to prevent hacking.

column4: Fiat Chrysler US to recall 7 810 SUVs to prevent hacking
column5: Sept 4 Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV's  U.S. arm said on Friday it would recall 7 810 sport utility vehicles in the United States to update software for radios to prevent hacking.

column4: Freeport Indonesia's copper shipments fall in August - union
column5: JAKARTA  Sept 4 Freeport-McMoran's  Indonesian unit exported only two shipments of copper concentrate during August  a union official said on Friday  as new payment rules for buyers and the closure of the company's domestic smelter hindered supplies.

column4: Japanese banks among bidders for GE's local finance unit
column5: Japanese banks are among bidders for General Electric Co's  local commercial lending and leasing operation  sources told Reuters on Friday.

column4: GE set for cost cuts as EU decision on Alstom deal nears
column5: General Electric Co is expected to win regulatory approval next week for its purchase of the power equipment business of France's Alstom  allowing the U.S. industrial conglomerate to finally carry out a major cost-cutting program 16 months after first announcing the deal.

column4: Foreign investors navigate turmoil in Chinese markets with new playbook
column5: BOSTON  Sept 3 Foreign investment funds are moving at breakneck speed to retool their strategies in an attempt to profit from Chinese stock markets whipsawed by panic  paranoia and unprecedented government intervention.

column4: Philips aims to take healthcare from hospitals into homes
column5: BERLIN Philips Electronics will emerge from its radical transition away from the lighting industry as a more profitable company focused on consumer healthcare  the head of the group's Personal Health business told Reuters.

column4: Lockheed wins deal worth up to $428 mln for U.S. Navy combat systems
column5: WASHINGTON  Sept 4 Lockheed Martin Corp  beat out Raytheon Co to win a contract worth up to $428 million to continue modernizing Aegis combat systems on U.S. Navy ships  the Pentagon announced on Friday.

column4: Saudi king to meet with Obama amid Gulf concerns over Iran deal
column5: WASHINGTON Saudi King Salman will meet with U.S. President Barack Obama in Washington on Friday to seek more support in countering Iran  as the Obama administration aims to use the visit to shore up relations after a period of tensions. | Video

column4: Russia's VTB to sign debt restructure deal with Mechel on Friday - Interfax
column5: VLADIVOSTOK  Russia  Sept 4 VTB  Russia's second-largest bank  plans to sign debt restructuring deal with coal producer Mechel on Friday  Interfax news agency reported  citing Andrei Kostin  VTB chief executive. column4: UPDATE 1-CSN cash crunch eases as it refinances 2016  2017 bank debt
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO/SAO PAULO  Sept 3 Brazilian steelmaker Cia Siderurgica Nacional said on Thursday it extended repayment of 2.57 billion reais ($687 million) of loans as it rushes to ease looming debt payments amid a decline in steel prices and demand and a weakening of Brazil's currency.

column4: Roche haemophilia drug wins fast-track FDA designation
column5: ZURICH  Sept 4 Roche said on Friday it had won breakthrough therapy designation from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration for an experimental haemophilia medicine  aiming for a piece of the $11 billion haemophilia drug market.

column5: Genzyme Corp agreed to pay $32.59 million  admit wrongdoing and enter a deferred prosecution agreement to resolve U.S. criminal charges over its marketing of the surgical implant Seprafilm  the Department of Justice said on Thursday.

column4: Mall developer Taubman's $500 million art collection up for auction
column5: NEW YORK The art collection of late U.S. mall developer A. Alfred Taubman  who served prison time in an auction house price-fixing scandal  is being put up for sale in what was described on Friday as the most valuable private collection ever offered at auction.

column4: Mall developer Taubman's $500 million art collection up for auction
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 4 Works by Pablo Picasso  Jackson Pollock and Amedeo Modigliani  are going up for auction from the late U.S. mall developer A. Alfred Taubman's collection  which is valued at more than $500 million  Sotheby's said on Friday.

column5: CERNOBBIO  Italy Sept 4 Telecom Italia  has not yet made a decision on  converting around 5.5 billion euros ($6.1 billion) of non-voting saving shares into ordinary ones  a spokesman said on Friday after a press report rekindled speculation about such a plan.

column4: Vale CEO still upbeat on China  iron ore market -paper
